title: Monarch Airlines passengers delayed nearly 24 hours in Sharm el-Sheikh
text:
90 shares 342
View
comments
Dozens of British holidaymakers were left furious after they were delayed for nearly 24 hours as they returned home from a beach getaway in Egypt.
One of the tourists claimed Monarch Airlines did not have any 'official representatives' on hand when their return flight to Birmingham was cancelled at the airport in Sharm el-Sheikh.
A mechanical problem meant that the Airbus A321 that was supposed to carry them back to Britain was unable to make the journey home from the Red Sea holiday resort.
Monarch Airlines passengers were forced to spend nearly an extra day in Sharm el-Sheikh, Egypt
The plane had to undergo an inspection and repairs, but the replacement had to fly in from the UK.
While they waited for that aircraft to arrive, about 200 holidaymakers, including young children, were put up in a hotel, allowing them to get some rest before the five-and-a-half hour flight.

Share this article Share 90 shares They should have arrived in Birmingham at 2:20am yesterday, but didn’t land until roughly 11pm.
Passenger Tarek Mohammed, who recorded footage of the angry holidaymakers at the Egyptian airport, told the Birmingham Mail : ‘We were not told our flight was cancelled until 20 minutes after take-off time.
‘There were no official representatives from Monarch. ‘Passengers were given each other’s personal information and were asked to sort out the chaos.’
Passengers were delayed for nearly 24 hours after an Airbus A321 suffered a mechanical problem (file photo)
A Monarch Airlines spokesperson told MailOnline Travel the plane ‘became unserviceable’ when it arrived in Sharm el-Sheikh.
The spokesperson added: ‘This has had a knock on effect to flight ZB473, which was due to operate back to Birmingham on the same day.
‘An alternative Monarch aircraft was organised and customers arrived back in Birmingham [yesterday].
‘The safety and comfort of our customers is always our first priority. Customers were given hotel accommodation, meals and refreshments for the duration of the delay.
‘We would like to apologise to affected passengers for the delay and any inconvenience this has caused.’
